intro: Oxalis quinata, commonly known as the wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in moist, well-drained soils. Oxalis quinata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms. It is also noted for its edible leaves, which have a tangy, sour flavor.
